metadata.name: the boy with a golden flute
metadata.description:
A boy was at war
trying to find himself
Society dictates, what ought to be but, 
he declined he fought his every thought, his very being. He was at war, war inflicts wounds into scars and trauma. it is painful, this life a boy must live in misery, but he saw in this misery he found comfort. as faded, one day he found a flute luring, beautiful it was strange where he found it, but he blew it... 
sounds so wonderful, magical you'd say.
the music from it, bewitching could make you feel whole, clear every bad thought, heal wounds, and erase scars.
a boy played his flute alone, far from people
 he caged himself in what he calls solitude
as he played his imagination grew, and it seems real.
 boy with the golden flute
 was at war with life, with himself, and with society.
he caged himself from all, playing his healing flute every day, every moment.
our boy with a golden flute plays all-day
visualizing a better place but in reality, he still is at war with himself, he can't run from that.
